direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the collection, but removeIf uses a predicate for conditional removal.
Both methods remove elements from the collection, but removeAll removes based on a collection of elements, while removeIf uses a predicate.
Both methods modify the collection by removing elements, but retainAll retains only the elements in the specified collection, while removeIf removes based on a predicate.
Both methods modify the collection by removing elements, but clear removes all elements, while removeIf removes based on a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the collection, but add inserts elements, while removeIf removes them based on a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the collection, but addAll inserts multiple elements, while removeIf removes them based on a predicate.
Both methods involve iterating over the collection, but contains checks for the presence of an element, while removeIf removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve checking elements in the collection, but containsAll checks for the presence of all elements in a collection, while removeIf removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve checking the state of the collection, but isEmpty checks if the collection is empty, while removeIf removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve interacting with the collection, but size returns the number of elements, while removeIf removes elements based on a predicate.
